channel.title: [FAQ] KeyCodes
channel.description:
So alot of people have questions as to what key is assigned what number, well here you go:
Please Note the the general use of these would be using: [scar]KeyDown(KeyCode); Sleep(time) //or wait, w/e you want KeyUp(KeyCode);[/scar]
Also Can be used with SendKeys, etc like so: [scar]SendKeys(chr(KeyCode));[/scar] Which would basically just allow you to hint enter within the same line of coding ;).
I prefer using KeyDowns and such though, because sendKeys doesnt always work for different internet games
[b]######### A-Z #########[/b] [code] A - 65 B - 66 C - 67 D - 68 E - 69 F - 70 G - 71 H - 72 I - 73 J - 74 K - 75 L - 76 M - 77 N - 78 O - 79 P - 80 Q - 81 R - 82 S - 83 T - 84 U - 85 V - 86 W - 87 X - 88 Y - 89 Z - 90 [/code]
[b]######### 0-9 Above A-Z Keys #########[/b] [code] 0 - 48 1 - 49 2 - 50 3 - 51 4 - 52 5 - 53 6 - 54 7 - 55 8 - 56 9 - 57 [/code] [b] ######### "F" Keys #########[/b] [code] F1 - 112 F2 - 113 F3 - 114 F4 - 115 F5 - 116 F6 - 117 F7 - 118 F8 - 119 F9 - 120 F10 - 121 F11 - 122 F12 - 123 //in case you have 15 of them F13 - 124 F14 - 125 F15 - 126 [/code]
[b]######### Number Pad #########[/b] [code] 0 - 96 1 - 97 2 - 98 3 - 99 4 - 100 5 - 101 6 - 102 7 - 103 8 - 104 9 - 105 Multiply - 106 Add - 107 Enter - 108 Subtract - 109 Decimal - 110 Divide - 111 [/code]
[b]######### Other Keys #########[/b] [code] Backspace - 8 Tab - 9 Clear - 12 Enter - 13 // next to a-z Shift - 16 Control - 17 Alt - 18 Capslock - 20 Escape - 27 Spacebar - 32 PageUp - 33 PageDown - 34 End - 35 Home - 36 Left Arrow - 37 Up Arrow - 38 Right Arrow - 39 Down Arrow - 40 Insert - 45 Delete - 46 Help - 47 Numberlock - 144 Semi-Colon / Colon - 186 Equals / Plus - 187 Minus / Underscore - 189 Forward Slash / Question Mark - 191 Apostrophe / Tilde - 192 Open Bracket / Open Brace - 219 Backslash / Seperator - 220 Close Bracket / Close Brace - 221 Quote Key - 222
Added!: PrintScreen - 44 "Start" Key - 92 [/code]
If there are any keys that I missed, or you found to be incorrect, please tell me.
Enjoy Your Scripting!!! -KyleGut3

item.title: [FAQ] KeyCodes
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

What happened to the keycodes?

I tried to make one on April Fools for my Dad (Because me an him usually play Bomberclone every night). And i wanted to use the keycode 40 using the SendKeys function. 40 is supposed to be the down arrow which should press the down arrow. But instead it just makes this letter/symbol: ((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((((.

Why, it is supposed to press the down key a.k.a down arrow?

Read full topic

item.title: [FAQ] KeyCodes
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

hmm I found this in my test folder. can this do it?

program New;
var
f: Integer;
begin
for f:= 1 to 255 do
begin
Writeln(IntToStr(f) + ’ = ’ + Chr(f));
end;
end.

Read full topic

item.title: [FAQ] KeyCodes
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

KyleGut3:

junior, make sure the window is targeted AND activated. I suggest putting an ActivateClient; command in front to make sure.

I removed that and just used this:
Highestangle;
I used the key codes untill i knew we had a procedure like that.
Sorry for the inconvience.
~jR

Read full topic

wait(1500+random(500));
KeyUp(38);[/scar]

why?
or is it only me?

Sleep(time) //or wait, w/e you want
KeyUp(KeyCode);

item.title: [FAQ] KeyCodes
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

yakman:

very useful, not many people know that in Runescape, if you hold the control key and shift, it run, so these keys could be used to make it seems more random

Holding Ctrl and then clicking will make you run. Holding Ctrl and Shift just does the same thing cause Ctrl is down. Why bother to press Shift?

Read full topic
